document.docTitle: Olecryptotendipes obtunsus Mukherjee & Hazra 2022, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: First records of three genera, Cyphomella Saether, 1977, Olecryptotendipes Zorina, 2007 and Robackia Saether, 1977 of the Harnischia complex from India with description of O. extentus sp. n., O. obtunsus sp. n. and R. aequilongia sp. n. (Diptera: Chironomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First records of three genera, Cyphomella Saether, 1977, Olecryptotendipes Zorina, 2007 and Robackia Saether, 1977 of the Harnischia complex from India with description of O. extentus sp. n., O. obtunsus sp. n. and R. aequilongia sp. n. (Diptera: Chironomidae)

Diagnosis. The new species is distinguished by the presence of an inverted Y-shaped superior volsella consisting of a non-sclerotised blunt outer part and a small sclerotised inner part, a parallel-sided anal point, weak shoulder-like corner on tergite IX and weak inferior volsella.

Etymology. The name â€˜
obtunsus
â€™ a Latin word, refers to the blunt outer part of the superior volsella; to be treated as an adjective.
Male (n=5). Total length 2.9â€“3.03, 2.96 mm . Wing length 1.97â€“2.1, 2.03 mm . Costal length 1.90â€“2.00, 1.95 mm . Antennal length 0.82â€“0.85, 0.83 mm .
Colouration. Thorax dark brown. Leg and abdomen yellowish brown.

Head. Head width 530â€“550, 540 Âµm. Temporal setae 9â€“10 (IV 2â€“3, OV 5, Po 2). Clypeal setae 10â€“12. Frontal tubercles absent. Eyes bare with dorsomedial extension of 80â€“90, 155 Âµm.AR 1.82â€“1.93, 1.87; ultimate flagellomere 530â€“560, 545 Âµm long. Palpomere lengths (Iâ€“V) (Âµm): 20: 40â€“50; 45: 90â€“110; 100: 120: 130â€“140; 135. CA 0.65â€“ 0.67, 0.66.
Thorax. Vittae present. Scutal tubercle absent. Acrostichals 10, dorsocentrals 6â€“7, prealars 3, supraalars 2â€“3, scutellars 6â€“8.
Wing ( Fig. 3A ). VR 1.07â€“1.12, 1.09. R 1 with 7â€“8 setae, R 4+5 bare. Brachiolum with 2 setae. Squama with 4 fringed setae. Anal lobe moderately developed.

Legs. Fore tibia with 3 setae. Mid legs with 2 tibial spurs; 23â€“25.3, 24.15 Âµm and 25.3â€“27.6, 26.45 Âµm long with 24â€“30 teeth. Hind leg with 2 tibial spurs; 27.6â€“29.9, 28.75 Âµm and 32.2 Âµm long with 44â€“50 teeth. Lengths and proportions of leg segments shown in table 3.
Abdomen. Tergite IX with weak shoulder-like corner on each side of anal point.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 3Aâ€“E. Adult male
Olecryptotendipes obtunsus
sp. n .
A. Wing, B. Hypopygium, C. Hypopygium, scale 0.01 mm, D. Superior volsella, scale 0.01 mm, E. Superior volsella, scale 0.01 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The new species is similar to
Olecryptotendipes exilis
Yan, Wang et Bu, 2012
in having a parallel sided anal point, two setae on the superior volsella and a microtrichiose inner part of the superior volsella, but the absence of a spur-like posterolateral projection of superior volsella and lobe on tergite IX can differentiate the new species from
O. exilis
. The shape of the gonostylus and presence of a weak shoulder-like corner on tergite IX are similar in both new species and
O. melasmus Yan, Wang et Bu, 2012
but they differ in the shape of the superior volsella and anal point.

1. Acrostichals absent; R bare (Palaearctic: Russia ).......................................
O. secundus ( Zorina, 2003 )

3(2). Inferior volsella absent; antepronotals 2 (Palaearctic: Russia , China )............................
O. lenzi ( Zorina, 2001 )

- Inferior volsella lobeâ€“like; antepronotals 6â€“7 (Oriental China )..........................
O. exilis Yan, Wang et Bu, 2012

5(4). Superior volsella simple, digitiform (Oriental China )..................................
O. arienus Yan et Wang, 2017

- Superior volsella inverted, T-shaped in appearance (Orient: India ) ( Fig. 4A )..........................
O . extentus
sp. n.

6(4). Superior volsella curved basally, straight distally, with large posterolateral projection (Palaearctic and Oriental China ).............................................................................
O. melasmus Yan, Wang et Bu, 2012

- Superior volsella with a partially sclerotised beak-like small projection and a flap-like blunt non-sclerotised apicolateral projection (Orient: India ) (Fig 6A)..........................................................
O . obtunsus
sp. n.
